name: pm2.18

body.origin:
|- wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), w0)
-| wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), w0)
-| wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), w0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), w0))
-| wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), wi(wn(w0), wn(wi(wn(w0), w0))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), w0)
-| wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), wi(wn(w0), wn(wi(wn(w0), w0))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), wi(wn(w0), wn(wi(wn(w0), w0))))
-| wi(wn(w0), wi(w0, wn(wi(wn(w0), w0))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wi(wn(w0), w0), w0)
-| wi(wn(w0), wi(w0, wn(wi(wn(w0), w0))))

comment: Clavius's law, or "consequentia mirabilis" ("admirable consequence"). If a formula is implied by its negation, then it is true. Can be used in proofs by contradiction. Theorem *2.18 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 103. See also the weak Clavius law ~ pm2.01 . (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.)
